intro: Matayba apetala f. oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved matayba, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. Its flowers are typically yellow or pink, with five petals, and are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories.
